seriesJson.title: The Chicago lectures
seriesJson.description: This series presents lectures given at University of Chicago, focusing on the nature of human beings, their place in the universe, and their potentialities. The lectures were also published in The Bulletin of Atomic Scientists, beginning in September 1965.

node.title: Clifford Geertz, part 2
node.description: This program presents the second part of a speech by Clifford Geertz of the University of Chicago: "The Impact of the Concept of Culture on the Concept of Man."

node.title: Clifford Geertz, part 1
node.description: This program presents the first part of a speech by Clifford Geertz of the University of Chicago: "The Impact of the Concept of Culture on the Concept of Man."

node.title: James M. Redfield, part 2
node.description: This program features the second part of a lecture by James M. Redfield of the University of Chicago: "The Sense of Crisis."

node.title: James M. Redfield, part 1
node.description: This program features the first part of a lecture by James M. Redfield of the University of Chicago: "The Sense of Crisis."

node.title: Roger W. Sperry, part 2
node.description: This program presents the second part of a speech by Roger W. Sperry of the California Institute of Technology: "Brain, Mind and Humanist Values."

node.title: Derek J. de Solla Price, part 2
node.description: This program presents the second part of a speech by Derek J. de Solla Price of Yale University: "The Science of Science."

contributor.name: Price, Derek J. de Solla (Derek John de Solla), 1922-1983

node.title: George Wald, part 2
node.description: This program presents the second part of a speech by George Wald of Harvard University: "Biological Determinacy, Individuality, and the Problem of Free Will."

node.title: Willard F. Libby, part 2
node.description: This program presents the second part of a speech by Willard F. Libby, director of Institute of Geophysics, UCLA: "Man's Place in the Physical Universe."
